item.title: What Made The Detroit "Bad Boy" Pistons So Bad?
item.description: The Detroit “Bad Boy” Pistons. Made up of Isiah Thomas, Bill Laimbeer, Dennis Rodman, John Salley, Joe Dumars and more, the fierce, two-time, back-to-back NBA champions from the “Motor City” ruled basketball in the late 1980s and early 1990s. The combination of aggressive play on the court tied in with their superb defensive skills gave them the opportunity to take over the league with a new style of play, giving them the “Bad Boy” reputation.

item.title: Does The Amount of Hits By A Team In The NHL Weigh Into Their Wins?
item.description: Incredible, eye-opening and exhilarating do justice in describing the game of hockey. As the chilly air of the arena brushes upon your face, your heart beats faster and faster as each moment toward puck-drop passes by. There are so many aspects of this wonderful game that draw sellout crowds all across the United States of America. Whether Alex Ovechkin is breaking scoring titles year after year or Marc Andre-Fleury’s graceful, yet stupendous saves, take a crowd’s breath away, the most flashy parts of the game may not be the only driving factors into determining a team’s success.
